context: Amalia is thinking to herself

text.en: Focus...|Take a deep breath, squeeze, and lunge.

context: Amalia pierces a rabbit she's hunting

text.en: Another day, another one down.
Are you over there meditating or hunting? Skin that thing and let's keep moving, Amalia.
There's an art to this, Illari. Rush me and we get scolded by Professor Clydan for delivering sloppy furbearers. Again.
Fine fine. I'll leave those ones to you then. Meet me up ahead at the Barrier Vista when you finish.
Lazy little...

context: Amalia catches up with Illari, he's looking at something on the ground

text.en: Oi, Amalia! Have a look here.
Footprints?
What comes to mind?
Hmm, large print, but very irregular stride. Stature exceeding two meters and... possibly barefoot?
Don't tell me... you think the infiltrators left these?
There's no way the Guardians travel this far out. Let's track them and end this now.
I don't buy any of this but I'll at least follow along.
Someone's gotta make sure you don't hurt yourself again.
I expect you've already gathered enough furbearers for both of us?
Right, about that... Let's just hunt a few more along the way.

context: Amalia and Illari are traveling, following the footprints.

text.en: Y'know, this is the fourth infiltration this year.
Oh yeah, detective? How'd you figure that out?
I snuck into the attendance room while Professor Clydan was out training one morning.
They're hesitant to tell us, but I think the infiltrators are after someone.
I'm shocked.
It's surreal, isn't it? Who'd have thought they'd target our colony?
No, I'm shocked you managed to wake up before Professor Clydan's morning training.
Hmph, he's not the only one with a bit of discipline.
That's news to me.

context: Amalia and Illari see the barrier while chasing the infiltrators.

text.en: From out here the Barrier looks so small.
Don't get distracted. Let's keep following these footprints.

context: Amalia and Illari come across an abandoned village

text.en: This is it! This is where they're hiding.
I do see signs of recent occupancy, but this is all just the remains of the last generation, right?
What would they be doing in this dump?
It's the perfect hideout, isn't it? I know there's something near. I can almost smell it.
I'll save the hygiene remarks for another day.

context: Amalia and Illari making idle chat while searching for clues in the ruined village.

text.en: If infiltrators did get in, how do you think they crossed the Barrier?
Either there's an entrance the Elders are unaware of, or the Guardians are withholding the truth from us.
No way they'd lie to us. I heard the Guardians take an Usko Vow of Truth. If they lie... they combust!
That's just something they told us when we were younger so we wouldn't lie.
Don't tell me... you actually believed that nonsense?
Shades, Amalia. You've got everything figured out now that you're a Tracker, don't you?

context: Amalia and Illari making idle chat while searching for clues in the ruined village. They find a cemetery.

text.en: Statues?
These are tombstones. Previous generations would bury the dead within the colony in the soil.
Underground? Seems like a total waste of land.
Perhaps they want to be remembered.
Do we really need stone slabs to be remembered?
Interesting. I'd thought you of all people would understand. Especially after your-
I'd rather not talk about this.

context: Amalia and Illari find an entrance to a dungeon in the basement of a house in the ruined village. It leads to a dungeon.

text.en: I'd bet my left jewel there's infiltrators hiding out down here.
You ever try keeping thoughts to yourself?

context: Amalia and Illari are traveling through the underground dungeon.

text.en: Seems awfully spacious down here for a prison.
Older generations built underground chambers initially to capture convicts.
But as the Umbra spread, these chambers were retrofitted as emergency shelter.
I'll spare you the details. You're already losing focus, aren't you?
Sorry, you know lectures have literally put me to sleep.

context: Amalia and Illari are traveling through the underground dungeon.

text.en: You scared?
No, where would you get that idea?
You're trembling.
It's cold in here.

context: Amalia and Illari find a switch that opens a door while pressed

text.en: That door must be weight-activated.
What should we do?
Let's split up and find something to hold this button down.

context: Amalia and Illari reach a dead end in the dungeon

text.en: Looks like the trail ends here.
What? No way! After all those puzzles? Let's search the place for clues.
It's getting late. We really should get back soon.
It's not like we haven't been late to evening attendance before.
...Fine, but you owe me big time.
Add it to my tab.

context: Amalia and Illari find some old boots

text.en: Hmm... shoes?
These aren't colony-issued, right? You think it belongs to the infiltrators?
Of course they belong to someone in the colony. We should take them back to Professor Clydan.
C'mon, the sun is probably setting soon.
You're scared, aren't ya?
Don't be foolish. We're clearly somewhere we don't belong.

context: Amalia and Illari encounter the first boss.

text.en: Woah! Is this their queen?
Gods why did I agree to this again? We're going to be killed.
Not if we defeat her first.

context: Amalia and Illari defeat the boss

text.en: That was a close one.
I can't believe I agreed to come with you. We need to leave this place.
But what in shades was that thing? It almost spoke, didn't it?
Don't you get it? We were led here to be eaten by that thing.
B-But what about the infiltrators?
Gods, Illari. Use your head. There are some things better left unknown.
If we draw the curtains back, we may end up like the last generation.

context: Amalia and Illari return late to their village

text.en: Attendance was hours ago. Where have you been?
I know it's late, Professor. I'm willing to take responsibility. We ignored curfew hours and put ourselves at great risk.
Was this your idea? What brought you to hunt so late, returning with such a mediocre haul no less?
I planned to trek out to the vista.|I begged Amalia to join. I thought we might-
Might what? Sneak away from the watchful eye of the Guardians?|Get some time to yourselves?
It wasn't like that!
What was it like then? Hand over your haul and explain yourselves.
We found traces of the infiltrators leading to the ruined village.
You're forbidden from exploring the ruins. Furthermore, we've already gone over this.
There's no evidence of infiltration.
I won't have you spreading rumors amongst the orphans.
Well then, how do you explain these?
...Old boots? Don't mock me, child.
When you two disobey me I look bad. Being a Tracker means being responsible.
You've shown me time and time again a failure to follow basic orders. Tomorrow you're both on cleaning duty.
You're dismissed.
Sorry for dragging you along. I know being a Tracker is important to you. I shouldn't jeopardize that.
...Look, today's been fun but I think Clydan is right. There's no way anyone could get through the Barrier.
You're wrapped up in this fantasy when in reality the explanation is much simpler.
...Our classmates were attacked by these creatures.
Attacked? No way. What if there really is a breach?
Then you've got a lot more to worry about than impressing female Trackers.
Savage...
Meanwhile.

context: Shift to a new character, Reene. She's sleeping in a research lab.

text.en: Doctor... are you awake?
Doctor Reene!
Mmmgghh? Me? Of course I'm awake. What's the matter?
It's nearly midnight. Wouldn't want you to miss the last train.
Right then. Thanks for the reminder.
See you tomorrow!

context: Reene is leaving the lab.

text.en: Long day, Doctor?
Indeed. There are setbacks with a few of the colonies.
Until we can get everything under control Vades has me at 200% capacity.
I hope things resolve quickly. This job will be the death of you if you don't hurry home and spend some time with your family.
Family... of course. See you tomorrow.

context: Reene has boarded the train and is looking for a seat.

text.en: Oi- Holy shades!!
What do you want?
Out late for an outlander. You meeting a client for a private call? Maybe secret doctor role-play?
The hell are you going on about?
Look, whatever your client's paying I'll double it.
This is a train, not a brothel, piss-breath.
Look, I'm sorry. Just a little peek. Let me gaze into those eyes.
Yeah?
I've been so curious. I'll pay anything.
All right. But first, stand over there and close your eyes.
Okay, you ready?
Oh boy, am I!
Okay, here we go.
Ow, shit! Hey you better watch yourself, Eggplant!
Get lost, cretin.
...Too old for this.

context: Reene is interrupted by person who has been following her.

text.en: Show yourself.
D-Doctor Reene. Apologies for approaching unannounced. I'm Stevie Varyo III, Hand of Highlord Vades.
Do you have a seal?
Ah, right. Here you are.
...Granted.
Shall I dictate?
Yes, please.
Reene--I hope this message finds you well. We're contacting the colony with your findings and are notifying the Guardians.
Until this issue is resolved, however, we all must remain vigilant.
As you've surmised, if evidence of your project gets out I will be forced to swiftly terminate it. Vades.
Everything all right, Doctor? You're quivering.
Oh it's all right. Thank you, Hand. Was there anything else?
Did you want me to send a reply?
No, that will be all, thank you. This is for you.
Thank you very much, Doctor! Good evening to you!
Farewell, Stevie.

context: Reene enters her home.

text.en: People tend to add extra words when they want to sound important, but the message is always the same.
Clean up after yourself or pay the consequences. Funny how this is my project now.
No way the nobles would hold themselves accountable for anything.
It's debilitating. I don't know how much more of this I can take.
I know, I have to hang in there.|If I don't make it through this, who would feed you?
The following morning.

context: Morning in Tulron, with Amalia.

text.en: Cleaning duty today. I should make sure Illari is up so I don't get stuck with all the work.

context: Amalia leaves her home.

text.en: Ugh... I did not sleep well last night. Couldn't get that slime creature out of my head.

context: Amalia finds Illari asleep

text.en: Hey, wake up!
No way, lemme sleep.
Move it and get dressed. We've got work to do.
Okay, okay. Fine.
Okay, I'm ready. You look like you have something else to say, though?
Nope, let's head to the academy.
I can hardly wait.

context: Amalia and Illari reach the academy to do their chores

text.en: Great, looks like it's just the east and west wing today. Shall we split it up?
Sure thing. I don't really want to wait around for you when I'm done though.
I'd wager I'll finish before you.
You're on.
Loser takes waterwell duty next week?
Deal. Lightning Hands is at it again.

context: Amalia finishes cleaning, checks on Illari

text.en: The lengths you'll go to avoid cleaning duty never cease to amaze me.
Can't talk... trying to climb through window.
Oof, afraid I couldn't bear losing to you again.
Cut the crap. Where are you sneaking off to?
I know you said let the Guardians handle this, but I can't help myself.|I need to solve this.
Solve? What do you mean?
Professor Clydan left early today.|I suspect he's gone to explore the ruins and...
And you want to follow him? Seriously? After us nearly getting killed?
I don't want any more victims, Amalia.
Why do you feel so invincible? Something could just as easily happen to you.
You said you didn't want to get involved. I'm leaving you out of this one.
You... fine. It's impossible to get through that thick head of yours.|Do whatever you'd like.
Not like I need your permission. I'll be back before evening attendance.
What is he trying to prove, anyway?
Half-assed cleaning job.

context: Amalia is ready to head home after completing all her chores.

text.en: Phew, exhausted. I should finish up any errands and head back home to rest.

context: Amalia is ready to sleep.

text.en: Am I all done with everything?
What a frustrating day.
No rush. I have time to kill.

context: Late at night, Amalia as awoken by a knock at her door.

text.en: W-what time is it? Someone's knocking?

context: Illari is at the door. It's late.

text.en: Amalia! You're awake.
Well, yeah, after the knocking and all... what's wrong?
I've got some more details about the infiltrations.
Again with this? Can't it wait until tomorrow?
No, this is urgent. I tailed Clydan back to the ruins today.
Turns out he's planning to intercept the next infiltration and catch the perpetrators himself.
How are they getting in?
There's an entrance in the colony mines. Abandoned, but apparently not vacant.
This is great. Let me sleep and we'll discuss this with the Guardians tomorrow.
No, here's the thing. The infiltration is happening-
You... expecting guests?
Of course not. Keep quiet.
Illari!
Hold it. No sudden movements.
Hands off, man!
Silence, both of you.|This one's coming with us.
Let go of him!
We said no sudden movements. Follow our orders and you'll make it out of here alive.
Not much time before the arrival. Let's move.
I've gotta find Illari before it's too late.

context: Amalia encounters some slimes deep inside the caverns searching for Illari

text.en: More slimes? Shades, there's a lot of them. Maybe there's another way.
Persistent little things, aren't you?
Our intel was accurate. You are clever. Amalia, is it?
What do you want? Where's Illari?
We warned you not to get involved. This is your second opportunity to leave unscathed.
Drop your weapon and leave peacefully.
Explain yourself or pry it from my fingers.
It's simple. Your colony intrigues us:|a handful of citizens with exorbitant protection from the Umbra.
What impotent leader would justify this waste of resources when thousands squander to survive?
Take it up with your leader. This has nothing to do with us.
It does. I don't want to hurt you, but I will do whatever it takes to feed my family.
Don't worry. Your family can eat the scum off of my boots.
Look alive, Amalia!

context: Amalia and her professor, Clydan, have a chat after defeating the slimes.

text.en: What are you doing down here?
I should be asking you the same. Damn it, what's going on?
We know about the infiltrations. Shouldn't the Guardians be handling this?
That doesn't concern you.
Something's happened to Illari and I've gotta rescue him. But you know that already, don't you?
Amalia, return home and let me handle this.
I get it now. You haven't told the Guardians. You're investigating the infiltrations yourself.
I don't know what impresses me more: your wits or Illari's stupidity.
I could be motivated to keep this exchange private. If...
Are you attempting to bargain with your professor?
C'mon, let me tag along.
Absolutely not.
Look, if you send me back I either notify the Guardians or find Illari myself.
Plus, it's safer if I just stick with you. Right, Professor?
...Fine, fine. But I have two simple rules you must follow.
First and foremost, if anything happens to me I want you to alert the Guardians immediately.
And second, we don't know the capabilities of our enemy, but if you're attacked, do not hesitate to fight back.
Use these if you're in a bind.
Flash bombs?
You didn't get those from me. Now, let's go.
Secondary Skills Unlocked!
You'll now earn a shared resource during battles: Thrill|Thrill is spent to use items during combat.
First, equip Items from the Tactics menu. Then, when you go into combat, hold [secondary] to access your equipped items.

context: Chatter in the mines while searching for Illari.

text.en: I'm a bit confused. You're smart... I suspect you knew of the infiltrations long before Illari, didn't you?
What makes you think that?
Just a hypothesis...
Anyway, what is it about Illari? Something happened between you during your initiation, am I right?
I'd rather not talk about something so personal.

context: Chatter in the mines while searching for Illari.

text.en: What's wrong?
This was Cou's vest.
He was one of the first that went missing, wasn't he?
Yes. Stay alert. I can't have anything happen to any more of my students.

context: Chatter in the mines while searching for Illari.

text.en: This is the first time I've been this far down in the mines.
You haven't snuck down here before? What about that time during solstice? Everyone was looking all over for you.
That? No way! I was just trying to get away from Harri. So annoying.
He means well. He really tries, you know.
If only he tried to bathe every now and again.

context: Chatter in the mines while searching for Illari.

text.en: Your hypothesis was right. Well, sort of.
Huh? Oh, the infiltrations? So you knew?
Not quite. I felt it indirectly... When the other orphans were taken, I mean.
You felt it?
How do I explain? Maybe like some sort of tug at my soul. I felt something slip away.
Hmm... A supernatural bond with the orphans?
You don't believe me, do you?
I won't dismiss something I don't understand.

context: Chatter in the mines while searching for Illari.

text.en: So assuming you do have this supernatural bond with the orphans, why didn't you notify me sooner?
Why bring more attention to myself? You've seen how the others treat me.
Besides, when we finally did bring evidence, you scolded us.
I scolded you for disobeying curfew. The Guardians... I'm worried if this gets out...
Would they fire you?
That's the least of my worries.

context: Amalia and Clydan find a mine cart

text.en: Their hideout must run deep within these mines.
What are you doing?
Checking the structural integrity of these carts. We'll be taking them down to the lower levels.
Sounds great. Let's go.
Wait. I haven't checked the safety harness.
What safety harness? We'll be fine. Probably.
Just a moment... Got it. Now, hold on.
Before we proceed there's a few important safety precautions to note.
No time. Illari needs us.
Press the confirm key to jump.|Collect coins for goodies.

context: Amalia and Clydan discover a full-blown train station in the mines.

text.en: Unbelievable! An operational train station deep under the colony?
There were whispers of an underground station amongst the faculty.
However, the Guardians insisted it was defunct.
Illari knew. We were on the brink of exposing this when suddenly-
Hold that thought. Someone's coming.
Excellent. Looks like we're right on time.
Good work. Are preparations complete?
Yes, commander.
Let's not waste any time. Shall we?
Okay. We've gotta move fast here. Amalia, now's the time to report back to the Guardians.
Let's present the evidence, get a Tracker party down here, and tail these guys.
If we're quick enough to get a bird out to the capital, we can cut them off before they get too far.
Sound good, Amalia?
Amalia?
You've gotta be kidding me!

context: Clydan hops onto the train and finds Amalia.

text.en: You know, it's almost like you're trying to get captured, Amalia.
How could I possibly get us out of this mess?
I didn't actually think that far ahead. I saw Illari and I just moved on instinct.
Honest recklessness, then. Let's stick together and sneak our way to the back.
If anything should happen to me, hide and stay safe.

context: Aboard the train, searching for Illari.

text.en: Hold it right there!
So much for that idea.
Let's just make our way to the back.

context: Amalia and Clydan reach the back of the train.

text.en: Shades, it's locked.
We've got more coming, Clydan.
You're trapped. Give up, fools.
Surrounded? Possibly. Trapped? Not quite.
Did she just-?
Up here!
I'm getting too old for this...

context: Aboard the train, searching for Illari.

text.en: That worked out pretty well!
We're not out of the woods just yet. Watch your step, please.

context: Aboard the train, searching for Illari.

text.en: The boy belongs to the Soturi! Stand down before I knock you off this train.
These guys are relentless.

context: Aboard the train, searching for Illari.

text.en: We're approaching the end of the mines. Brace yourself!

context: Amalia and Clydan are searching for Illari on the train.

text.en: Give up, Clydan.
Show yourself!
What are you doing? Scrambling across the tops of trains, getting into mischief with presumably your students?
I must protect them...|But what would you know about protecting people, Esteri?
I had no choice... nor do I now.|Didn't you tell me freedom is an illusion?
Don't do this. I know things fell apart, but there's opportunity for you in the colonies. Turn things around.
You see, even if I wanted to take you up on that offer, I don't think this one would.
Illari?
It's best you return to Tulron with your tail between your legs and mention nothing of our encounter.
We only want this one.
We're not leaving without him.
Can you stop me?

context: Amalia and Clydan beat Esteri.

text.en: Enough, already. We've got you beat.
Your arrogance will be your downfall.
Illari... H-help me.
Go on, Illari. You know what you must do.
Illari, w-why?
For once, I can finally protect you.
What are you talking about?
Goodbye.
End of demo.
Thanks a bunch for playing through the demo! I hope you enjoyed it.
Starless Umbra is for the moment a solo project, with help from a couple talented freelance artists.
This demo is roughly 15-20% of the game's planned content. It's a huge work-in-progress years away from completion.
To support me and get early access to more content [4 more dungeons], please visit starlessumbra.com or join the discord to learn more.
Even if you aren't interested in supporting at this time, please stop by and let me know what you think of the project.
Wishing you the best. Stay cool!
